results.title: The Wild one [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Laslo Benedek, Stanley Kramer and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: A group of youths in a motorcycle gang ride into a small Californian town and begin to terrorize the locals. Johnny, the leader of the gang, falls in love with a woman in town but any hope for their relationship is ruined by both the aggression of his fellow bikers, and the prejudices and closed-mindedness of the town’s people. “The Wild one” is one of many Hollywood movies to represent the emerging sub-cultures of alienated and dissatisfied Western youth who were the immediate predecessors to the generation in the sixties who were to create the upheaval of the “counter- culture”. Initially banned in Australia on its release, “The Wild one” is also notable for Marlon Brando’s electrifying performance as Johnny and its (then) innovative use of a rock and roll music score.

results.title: The Wild Duck
results.creator_credit: Henri Safran, Phillip Emanuel and Film Bancor of Aust
results.brief_description: Based on the play by Henrik Ibsen about the fortunes of a loving family - the ineffectual loving father whose pride and dreams conceal a life of poverty and failure, his practical wife and their beautiful and faithful young daughter. The family is broken apart when deceived by the misplaced idealism of another person. Stars Liv Ullman and Jeremy Irons.

results.title: The Wild cell
results.creator_credit: Aram Boyajian, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS News
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Reviews what is known about the causes, diagnoses and treatments of cancer. Uses photo- micrography, animation, and multi-screen techniques to show how cancer effects and spreads through the body

results.title: The Wild bunch [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Sam Peckinpah, Phil Feldman and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: In 1913, a gang known as “The Wild Bunch”, rode into a Texas border town disguised as U.S. soldiers. Silently they entered the railroad office and robbed it. Perched on the rooftops above was a ring of hired gunmen waiting for their prey. When the gang emerged they opened fire. An exciting, provocative and influential film that breathed new life into Westerns, it brings together an all-star cast of fine actors at the peak of their talents to play the band of magnificent losers in a dying, lawless West. A documentary, “The Wild Bunch: an album in montage”, as well as a new introduction by Ernest Borgnine precedes the movie.

results.title: The Wik, the law & the land (A)
results.creator_credit: Rebecca Latham and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Four corners (Television program)”.
The Labor Government’s Native Title Bill was passed in December 1993, acknowledging the entitlement of the Aboriginal people, in accordance with their laws and customs, to their traditional lands. The High Court’s Wik decision in 1996 removed long held assumptions about land tenure in Australia and created uncertainty in the minds of pastoralists and miners. Aboriginal groups however, believed that the decision would have little impact and that the farmers were generally over-reacting. Co-existence in the form of upgraded land tenure for the pastoralists and traditional access to the land for the Aborigines could lead to long-term stability - at least that was the aim of the Cape York Agreement. The Federal Government under the leadership of John Howard, found itself coming increasingly under pressure from the National Farmers Federation to nullify the High Court’s judgement and extinguish native title. This program examines the issues. Reporter: Murray McLaughlin.

results.title: The Wiggles: yummy yummy
results.creator_credit: Chisholm McTavish, Nick Pike and Wiggles Touring Pty Ltd
results.brief_description: Greg, Murray, Anthony and Jeff sing 14 of your favourite songs; “Hot potato”, “D.O.R.O.T.H.Y”, “Pufferbillies”, “Henry’s dance”, “Walk”, “Joannie works with one hammer”, “The Monkey dance”, “Crunchy munchy honey cakes”, “Shaky shaky”, “Teddy bear hug”, “Havena shalom alachem”, “I am a dancer”, “Numbers rhumba” and “Fruit salad”. There are special appearances from Captain Feathersword, Henry the Octopus, Wags the Dog and Dorothy the Dinosaur.

results.title: The Wiggles: Yummmy yummy. Wiggle time
results.creator_credit: Chisholm McTavish, Nick Pike, Wiggles Touring Pty Ltd and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: Let the four coloured Wiggles entertain your pre-school child with simple songs that they can sing and dance along to. The Wiggles are presented here in a in a studio setting with simple sets and colourful costumes suitable for the very young. Jeff, Murray, Anthony and Greg are also joined by Wags the Dog, Henry, Dorothy the Dinosaur and Captain Feathersword. “Yummy Yummy” includes such songs as “Hot Potato”, “Walk”, and “Fruit Salad” with a total of fourteen to choose from. “Wiggle Time” songs include “Get Ready to Wiggle”, “Captain Feathersword” and “Rock-A-Bye Your Bear” amongst ten other titles.

results.title: The Wiggles: Wiggle Bay
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Bufalo, Paul Field, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Wiggles Touring Company
results.brief_description: Join the Wiggles and friends Wags the Dog, Henry the Octopus and Captain Feathersword as they head out on a special day at Wiggle Bay. Their plans appear to be ruined however when Captain Feathersword forgets to tie up the boat and it drifts out to sea - fortunately the Wiggles are able to amuse themselves with sand castles, fishing, spending time with Henry’s friend Magdalena the Mermaid, barbecuing, rolling down hills, and of course singing and dancing. All works out well and the Wiggles get a special shell call from King Neptune.

results.title: The Wiggles: Wake up Jeff!
results.creator_credit: Dean Covell, Keiran Usher, Wiggles Touring Company and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: Wake up Jeff! will have you jumping. Australia’s favourite children’s group “The Wiggles” are back singing and dancing in a brand new video. The Wiggles - Murray Cook, Jeff Fatt, Anthony Field and Greg Page, are joined by their friends Dorothy the Dinosaur, Henry the Octopus, Captain Feathersword and Wags his dog. Full of the songs and music that have made the Wiggles so well loved.
